docs.title: Become a Member
docs.description: To advance from an Apprentice to a Member, you will need to be Championed by an existing Save Dao Member. Once you find a Champion, there are a few Your champion will need to put down a stake of $save tokens. See the Champion a New Member for how this works.

docs.title: Become an Apprentice
docs.description: Save Dao has instituted a new onboarding process through the utilization of Cohorts.

docs.title: Champion a New Member
docs.description: Save Dao grows organically, adding new members as individual existing members deem appropriate and champion them in. Our championing process relies both on the Champion being a good judge of who is a good fit for the Dao as well as on the Champion’s reputation within the Dao being at stake.

docs.description: The Save party lead is responsible for working with the client to help them make their deposit into the escrow. The following deposit instructions can be shared with clients:

docs.title: Commission Process
docs.description: After the Save enters Prepping for Campaign, the Cleric who led the consultation is responsible for gathering additional Saveers as is necessary to scope out the full project.

docs.title: Meetings
docs.description: Open to the public:

docs.title: Overview
docs.description: There are a few meetings each week that we encourage all Dao Members to attend.  Save Rally is a meeting for Dao members to discuss progress across different RIPs and Saves, as well as provide teams in the _Preparing for Campaign phase with possible personnel for their Save/RIP.

docs.title: Channels
docs.description: Within the Save Dao Discord, you’ll notice a suite of Categories each full of different sub-channels. Here’s what you need to know about each.  You can join discord here//discord.gg/G2sXhQCpGg)

docs.title: Etiquette
docs.description: Before we get down and dirty, you should know that discord is the central communications hub for all things Save Dao.  With that in mind, there are some things you should know before you jump into the discord and begin taking up projects.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.description: You can join the Discord [here] (https://discord.gg/G2sXhQCpGg), If you have been assigned a “Save Dao Member” role, then you will be able to access all of Save Dao’s internal channels.

docs.title: Navigation
docs.description: There’s a lot going on in our Discord. Please never hesitate to ask questions if you get lost. The best place to do so is in #Tavern as an Apprentice or in #general or #ops as a Guilder.

docs.title: In Case of Dispute
docs.description: -   If the client loses confidence in the raid party at any time, they may Lock the remaining funds in escrow so that they cannot be released or withdrawn.

docs.title: Style Guide
docs.description: You can write content using GitHub-flavored Markdown syntax.

docs.title: Happy Path
docs.description: WARNING: Never send funds (tokens or ETH) directly to the escrow smart contract. Those funds will not be recoverable.

docs.description: How To: The Bridge to xDAI and wxDAI

docs.title: How Does It Work?
docs.description: Raid Guild has developed an on-chain escrow service to facilitate payments from clients. Using the Raid Guild escrow:

docs.title: Interacting With the Escrow
docs.description: -   As the warning above states, _never send ETH or ERC20 tokens directly to the escrow contract_. They will be lost forever. All deposits into an escrow must happen via the Deposit function. This can be done easily via the escrow app.

docs.description: Any member with at least one Share is eligible to join an existing Raid.

docs.title: Powered by MDX
docs.description: You can write JSX and use React components within your Markdown thanks to MDX.

docs.title: Migration to xDAI
docs.description: On February 18, 2021, Save Dao migrated its on-chain DAO to the xDAI network in order to reduce the burden of high gas fees on Ethereum mainnet and facilitate more on-chain interactions, governance, and experimentation.

docs.title: Intro
docs.description: Greetings Golden Ager!

docs.description: Before we dive in, here is a quick code of conduct to keep in mind:

docs.title: Moloch V2
docs.description: Save Dao utilizes the colony.io framework. A great overview of Moloch V2 and it’s benefits can be found here.

docs.title: Roles
docs.description: Just as with any strong Discord, we use Roles to showcase different skill sets. These Roles are used to Summon Guilders for different Raids, and should only be assigned if you can be called upon to complete the necessary tasks associated with each of them.

docs.title: Save Guild Shares
docs.description: All Shares are non-transferable and unique to the DAO being used (in this case Save Dao).
